summary: The documents provided do not contain any information about an individual named Jerry Ray. The documents primarily focus on communications between the FBI, its field offices, and the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) regarding investigations into the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy. The documents detail requests for files, informant information, and agent photographs related to these investigations. Mentions include investigations into individuals and groups like the National States Rights Party and COINTELPRO operations.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Jerry Ray has no significance in the JFK context.
